text: [Music]
hi I'm Anderson a cloud support engineer
here at AWS Yost in Cape Town South
Africa sometimes customers ask me how do
I create a custom window zmi I tell them
to create an mi from existent instance
as a best read we showed around sysprep
to remove our system specific
information including the computer
security identifier also know as s ID
let's get it started it's important to
know a few things when using sysprep
don't use this prep to create a backup
of your instance because this prep
remove system specific information you
might experience unintended consequences
for an instance backup if you do so it's
not a bad spread to use this prep with a
production instance to be safe first
create an EMI of your instance then
launch an instance from an EMI outside
any network that has access to your
Active Directory preferably in a
different VPC finally run through the
SIS prep process for Windows Server 2008
through Windows Server 2012 r2 use the
ec2 config to initiated sysprep
as you can see I'm already logging to
AWS management console navigate to the
ec2 dashboard then on the Left I will go
ahead and choose instance choose my
instance check the IP address of the
source instance that we'll use to create
DMI connect it your ec2 instance using
remote desktop protocol RDP after
connecting from the Windows Start menu
open ec2 config self-seed settings go to
image tab for administrator password
choose e√§rendil choose shut down with
sysprep choose es for the confirmation
prompt wait for the instance to move it
to a stop at state now we are ready to
create an Amazon machine image select
your instance choose actions on the top
choose the image create image for image
name enters a name for image description
enter description click create image
click close go to EMI stab on the left
you check the status of your image
creation after the image completes you
can start the instance you previously
stop it go back to ec2 dashboard and
wait until the instance is running
select the instance click actions
instances state is start click e as a
start and wait until the instance is
running now we have a suspected image
which can be used to launch a new
instance thanks for watching in help
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
